South African President refers to relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The DPRK's dispatch of a high-level delegation to the world summit on sustained development would greatly contribute to the development of the relations between the two countries and the success of the summit, said Thabo Mbeki, President of South Africa, on September 2 when he met Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, who was participating in the summit.
 Noting that the African National Congress of South Africa has long supported and cooperated with the Workers' Party of Korea and the DPRK's government, maintaining excellent relations with them, he stressed that he would make efforts to boost these relations.

DPRK fine art show opens in China 
    Beijing, September 4 (KCNA) -- A DPRK fine art show was opened in Beijing on Tuesday under the co-sponsorship of DPRK's Mansudae Art Studio and China's Beijing Cultural Bureau and Beijing Library.
 On display at the show are over 60 fine art works created by Sonu Yong, People's Artiste of the Mansudae Art Studio. Among those works are Korean paintings "Mangyongdae in Spring", "Jong Il Peak" and "Osandok in Spring".    
 The show continues until Sept. 13.

articles.content:
Floral basket to Kim Jong Il
    Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The military attaches' corps here sent a floral basket and a congratulatory letter to  Kim Jong Il, supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, on the occasion of the 54th birthday of the DPRK.
 The floral basket and letter were handed to vice-marshal Kim Il Chol, minister of the People's Armed Forces, by Yan Jiangfeng, military attache of the Chinese embassy, who is doyen of the corps, on Friday.
